text: кадамба кешяра    джіні ектī пулака ре!
translation: His peerless form defeats the purest gold. His form is decorated with a garland of many kinds of flowers. His form is covered with hairs standing erect, hairs that defeat the filaments of *kadamba* flowers. His form is covered with drop after drop of perspirations.

text: джіні’ мадаматта ха̄ті    ґамана мантхара аті
translation: His slow walking defeats the walking of intoxicated elephants. Overcome with ecstatic love, He staggers and staggers as He walks. His saffron garments defeat the beautiful colour of the rising sun. His fair limbs play in the waves of spiritual pastimes.

text: чаліте на̄ па̄ре ґора̄-    ча̄нд ґонса̄і ре
бга̄вете а̄вешя хоія    харі харі бола̄ія
translation: Overcome, Lord Gauracandra has no power to walk. Now He has no power to speak. Half words are all He speaks. Overcome with ecstatic love, He chants, “Hari! Hari!” Everyone, even the lowest outcaste, He embraces in His arms.

text: е сукха-сампада-ка̄ле    ґора̄ на̄ бгаджіну хеле
translation: Alas! At that blissful fortunate time I did not worship Lord Gaura. I did not yearn to attain His feet. In this way Vṛndāvan das sings the glories of Lord Caitanyachandra and Lord Nityānanda.
